Okay, so my work is generally about using posteriors in speech recognition systems and somehow enhancing the estimation of posteriors, getting new posteriors which are more informative by somehow integrating some extra knowledge like prior knowledge and contextual information related to the problem and then use this posterior estimation method for designing hierarchical speech recognition system. So in this hierarchical architecture I will be able to integrate the extra knowledge at the proper level of hierarchy, and I will be also able to combine different kind of knowledge or sources sources of knowledge I have. As generally posteriors are estimated using neural networks and more specifically MLPs in a speech recognition system, time limited window of a speech signal is represented by some cepstral features, which are then processed by an MLP and it gives us some evidence in the form of phone posteriors. Then we use these phone posteriors as features or as scores for either just decoding or training and inference training and then decoding. But we know that in this case we are not able to integrate line contextual information, and we are not able to integrate the prior knowledge we can have about phone use or about words in the posterior estimation, so the main motivation is to see if we can integrate this kind of extra knowledge in the posterior estimation. So what is proposed to solve this problem is to use what we formally use in formalism, which is called gamma state posterior. For training or decoding, so it's it's a state posterior probablility in a HMM, which is defined as the probability of being in a specific state at a specific time, having the whole observation sequence and the model. So whole observation sequence means having complete contextual information and the model can encode some kind of prior knowledge for us by means of topological constraints. So as you see, introducing more reasonable prior knowledge will help to have better performance in almost all the cases. And here I compare the performance of the gamma base system with the standard GMM system, which is based on doing decoding using likelihood as the scores, and the difference is that our system is using posteriors for decoding, so as you see it's working better than the standard GMM system. sentences.displayText: So I think it's better to first have a presentation of my work and then we can discuss with this crash in temp what we can do for my future to continue my research, because apparently I will have serious problems, okay.
So I will start with the presentation of my work.
You can be sitting here itself and do the presentation.

Okay, so my work is generally about using posteriors in speech recognition systems and somehow enhancing the estimation of posteriors, getting new posteriors which are more informative by somehow integrating some extra knowledge like prior knowledge and contextual information related to the problem and then use this posterior estimation method for designing hierarchical speech recognition system.

So in this hierarchical architecture I will be able to integrate the extra knowledge at the proper level of hierarchy, and I will be also able to combine different kind of knowledge or sources sources of knowledge I have.

As generally posteriors are estimated using neural networks and more specifically MLPs in a speech recognition system, time limited window of a speech signal is represented by some cepstral features, which are then processed by an MLP and it gives us some evidence in the form of phone posteriors.
Then we use these phone posteriors as features or as scores for either just decoding or training and inference training and then decoding.

But we know that in this case we are not able to integrate line contextual information, and we are not able to integrate the prior knowledge we can have about phone use or about words in the posterior estimation, so the main motivation is to see if we can integrate this kind of extra knowledge in the posterior estimation.
So what is proposed to solve this problem is to use what we formally use in formalism, which is called gamma state posterior.

For training or decoding, so it's it's a state posterior probablility in a HMM, which is defined as the probability of being in a specific state at a specific time, having the whole observation sequence and the model.
So whole observation sequence means having complete contextual information and the model can encode some kind of prior knowledge for us by means of topological constraints.
This gamma posterior is written in terms of forward and backward recursions, and actually one way to use this gamma posteriors is using these posteriors as some kind of newer scores for decoding.
So in this case it will be similar to hybrid method.
The difference is that we do one more step, maybe I can explain it better there.

So we do one more step here, and here by means of another we introduce some kind of prior knowledge and contextual information, we get better evidences than what we initially had here, and then we do the decoding and the and more informative posteriors instead of this one.
So we are expecting the system to perform better and more robust to noisy cases.

Here you see some results and what is the effect of introducing reasonable prior knowledge, so different rows in this table are showing different level of noise and also clean speech, and different columns are showing different kind of posteriors or gamma posteriors.
So the first column is showing our baseline system, which is getting estimate of posteriors out of MLP and then using these posteriors for decoding.

And the other columns are showing the performance of different kind of gamma, so gamma which is estimated using information about minimum duration of phonemes, about possible transition between phonemes and some more prior knowledge which word is composed of which phonemes and grammatical knowledge about transition between words and things like this.
So as you see, introducing more reasonable prior knowledge will help to have better performance in almost all the cases.

And here I compare the performance of the gamma base system with the standard GMM system, which is based on doing decoding using likelihood as the scores, and the difference is that our system is using posteriors for decoding, so as you see it's working better than the standard GMM system.

And finally the conclusion is here we saw how we can get some more informative posteriors by introducing extra knowledge like prior and contextual information, and then using this posterior estimation method to design hierarchical speech recognition system which the goal is to have a more efficient and more robust system.
